tit.e: Gamo Sodo (The Feud of the Gamo family)
Gamo Sodo (The Feud of the Gamo Family)
Gamo Sodo (The Feud of the Gamo Family)

sen.j: 蒲生騒動（がもうそうどう）は、文禄4年（1595年）から慶長3年（1598年）まで起こった会津若松92万石の領主・蒲生氏の御家騒動。
sen.e: Gamo Sodo was the family dispute caused by the Gamo Clan, which was the head of the estate of Aizu-wakamatsu with nine hundred twenty thousand koku (a hundred sixty five thousand nine hundred fifty nine cubic meters of rice crop yields) which occurred between 1595 to 1598.

Gamo Sodo was the family dispute caused by the Gamo clan, which headed the estate of Aizu-wakamatsu with 920,000 koku (165,959 cubic meters of rice-crop yield), which occurred over the period from 1595 to 1598.

Gamo Sodo was a family dispute occurred to the Gamo clan, which headed the estate of Aizu-wakamatsu with 920,000 koku of rice (165,959 cubic meters of rice-crop yield), which occurred between 1595 and 1598.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: なお、蒲生氏郷の孫蒲生忠知の死後、無嗣断絶に至った御家騒動もまた、蒲生騒動と呼ばれている。
sen.e: The family dispute that led to Mushi Danzetsu (extinction of a family line) after the death of Tadatomo GAMO, who was the grandson of Ujisato GAMO, was also called as Gamo Sodo.
The family dispute that led to Mushi Danzetsu (extinction of a family line) after the death of Tadatomo GAMO, who was the grandson of Ujisato GAMO, was also called as Gamo Sodo.
The family dispute, which led to extinction of a family line after the death of Tadatomo GAMO, who was the grandson of Ujisato GAMO, is also called as Gamo Sodo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 文禄4年（1595年）2月、会津若松の城主・蒲生氏郷が40歳の若さで死去した。
sen.e: Ujisato GAMO, who was the lord of the castle of Aizu-wakamatsu, passed away when he was forty years old in March 1595.
Ujisato GAMO, the lord of the castle of Aizu-wakamatsu, passed away at age 40 in March 1595.
Ujisato GAMO, the lord of the castle of Aizu-wakamatsu, passed away at age 40 in March 1595.

sen.j: このため、氏郷の嫡男である蒲生秀行 (侍従)が家督を継いだが、まだ13歳の若年であった。
sen.e: As a result, Hideyuki GAMO (jiju (a chamberlain)), who was the legal son of Ujisato, inherited the family head position but at the young age of thirteen.
As a result, Hideyuki GAMO (jiju (a chamberlain)), who was the legal son of Ujisato, inherited the family head position at just 13 years of age.
As a result, Hideyuki GAMO (a chamberlain), who was the legal son of Ujisato, succeeded as the family head at 13 years of age.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: このため、幼少の秀行に代わって蒲生家の政務を執行する補佐役が必要となった。
sen.e: Therefore, there was a need for a substitute who would carry out the political duties of Gamo Family in place of young Hideyuki.
Thus there was a need for a substitute who would carry out the political duties of the Gamo family in place of young Hideyuki.
Thus there was a need for a guardian who would carry out the political duties of the Gamo family in place of the young Hideyuki.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: このとき、その補佐役となったのが、蒲生郷安という人物である。
sen.e: Satoyasu GAMO was chosen as a substitute during this time.
Satoyasu GAMO was chosen as a substitute at that time.
Satoyasu GAMO was chosen as the guardian for him.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この郷安は、もとは六角氏の家臣であったが、六角氏が滅亡した後、氏郷の家臣となった人物である。
sen.e: Satoyasu was originally the vassal of Rokkaku Clan but became the vassal of Ujisato when the clan fell.
Satoyasu had originally been a vassal of the Rokkaku clan, but he became a vassal of Ujisato when the Rokkaku clan fell.
Satoyasu had originally been a vassal of the Rokkaku clan, but became a vassal of Ujisato when the Rokkaku clan fell.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 氏郷は郷安を寵愛し、岩瀬郡の長沼城 (陸奥国)に3万5000石を与えて厚遇した。
sen.e: Ujisasato favored Satoyasu and granted him the estate of Naganuma-jo Castle (Mutsu Province) in Iwase District with thirty five thousand koku (six thousand three hundred fourteen cubic meters rice crop yield).
Ujisasato favored Satoyasu and granted him the estate of Naganuma-jo Castle (Mutsu Province) in Iwase District with 35,000 koku (6,314 cubic meters of rice-crop yield).
Ujisato favored Satoyasu and granted him the estate of Naganumajo Castle in Iwase District (Mutsu Province) with 35,000 koku (6,314 cubic meters of rice-crop yield).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: それほど有能な人物である。
sen.e: He was a competent person as much.
He was a competent person as such.
He was such a competent person.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: ところが郷安は氏郷存命中から豊臣秀吉の最側近である石田三成と誼を通じていた。
sen.e: However, Satoyasu befriended Mitsunari ISHIDA, who was the close servant of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI from the time when Ujisato was alive.
However, Satoyasu befriended Mitsunari ISHIDA, who had been the close servant of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI from the time when Ujisato was alive.
On the other hand, Satoyasu befriended Mitsunari ISHIDA, who had been the close servant of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, when Ujisato was alive.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: （このため、一説に郷安が三成の意を受けて氏郷を毒殺したのではないかという説もなされている。
sen.e: (As a result, there was a theory that Satoyasu received the will of Mitsunari and assassinated Ujisato with poison.
(Consequently, there was a theory that Satoyasu had received the will of Mitsunari and assassinated Ujisato by poisoning.
(For this reason, there was a view that Satoyasu had received the will of Mitsunari and assassinated Ujisato by poisoning.)
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: ただ、毒殺説自体は現在ではほぼ否定されている）。
sen.e: However, the theory of assassination itself is mostly denied in recent days.).
However, the assassination theory is largely denied today.)
(But the assassination view is largely denied today.)
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 九戸の乱後に氏郷が加増された頃から、蒲生家における家老職にあたる仕置奉行の筆頭として政務を執っていた郷安であったが、文禄の役で氏郷が名護屋に出陣している際に、会津で重臣の蒲生郷可、蒲生郷成らと一触即発の自体を招くなど、家中では対立する人々が多かった。
sen.e: Satoyasu worked as the head of a police magistrate in Gamo Family which belong to the position of Karo (chief retainers) to perform political duties from the time when Ujisasato received additional estates after the Kunohe War, but there were many who opposed to each other within the family as he came into hair-trigger situation with the chief retainers, Satoyoshi GAMO and Satonari GAMO, in Aizu while Ujisasato raised the army and travel to Nagoya during the Bunroku War.

Satoyasu worked as the head of a police magistrate in the Gamo family, which held the position of Karo (chief retainers) to perform political duties from the time that Ujisasato received additional estates after the Kunohe War, but there were many who opposed each other within the family as he came into a hair-trigger situation with the chief retainers Satoyoshi GAMO and Satonari GAMO in Aizu, while Ujisasato raised the army and traveled to Nagoya during the Bunroku War.

Satoyasu worked as the head of a police magistrate in the Gamo family, which held the position of chief retainer to perform political duties from the time when Ujisasato received additional estates after the Kunohe War, but there were many who antagonistic to each other within the family as he came into the hair-trigger situation with the chief retainers Satoyoshi and Satonari GAMO in Aizu, while Ujisato raised the army and traveled to Nagoya during the Bunroku War.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 氏郷の死後、政務を独占したため、蒲生郷可、蒲生郷成、それに小姓組の筆頭格であった亘理八右衛門らと完全に対立するに至った。
sen.e: Since he dictated the political duties after the death of Ujisato, he came in a complete confrontation with Satoyoshi GAMO, Satonari GAMO, and Hachiemon WATARI, who was the top of the koshogumi (page corps).

Because he had dictated the political duties since the death of Ujisato, he found himself in a direct confrontation with Satoyoshi GAMO, Satonari GAMO and Hachiemon WATARI, who was the top of the koshogumi (page corps).

As he had dictated the political duties since Ujisato died, he found himself in the direct confrontation with Satoyoshi and Satonari GAMO and Hachiemon WATARI, who was the top of the koshogumi (page corps).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: ところが郷安は事もあろうに、八右衛門を会津若松城（一説に、蒲生氏の京都屋敷）に誘き寄せて上意討ちとして斬殺してしまったのである。
sen.e: However, Satoyasu lured Hachiemon to Aizu Wakamatsu Castle (one theory stated that it was the palace of Gamo Clan in Kyoto) and assassinated him while putting the blame as an offender.
However, Satoyasu lured Hachiemon to Aizu Wakamatsu Castle (one theory stated that it was the palace of the Gamo clan in Kyoto) and assassinated him but placed the blame on "an offender."
But Satoyasu attracted Hachiemon to Aizu Wakamatsujo Castle (according to an opinion, it was the palace of the Gamo clan in Kyoto) and assassinated him on the pretext of 'kill of offender.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: これに激怒した蒲生家譜代の家臣・町野繁仍らは郷安を暗殺すべく、軍勢を集め、両派は一触即発の事態となった。
sen.e: The group of 町野繁仍, who were the vassals of Gamo family over generations, became infuriated and mobilized the army to assassinate Satoyasu and both sides came into a hair-trigger situation.

The group of 町野繁仍, who had for generations been vassals of the Gamo family, became infuriated and mobilized an army to assassinate Satoyasu, whereupon the two sides came into a hair-trigger situation.

The group of Shigeyorio MACHINO, who had for generations been vassals of the Gamo family, became infuriated and mobilized an army to kill Satoyasu, whereupon the two sides came into the hair-trigger situation.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: このような一連の御家騒動が、慶長3年（1598年）に伏見にあった秀吉のもとに届いた。
sen.e: These series of family disputes reached the ears of Hideyoshi who was residing in Fushimi in 1598.
In 1598 these series of family disputes reached the ears of Hideyoshi, who was residing in Fushimi.
In 1598 the series of family disputes became known to Hideyoshi, who was residing in Fushimi.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 秀吉は直ちに蒲生郷安を召還して取り調べた。
sen.e: Hideyoshi immediately summoned Satoyasu GAMO and investigated him.
Hideyoshi immediately summoned Satoyasu GAMO and investigated him.
Hideyoshi immediately summoned Satoyasu GAMO to interrogate him.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: ところが、郷安は微罪であるとして加藤清正にその身柄を預けられるだけであった。
sen.e: However, he determined that Satoyasu made just a petty crime and handed his custody over to Kiyomasa KATO.
However, he determined that Satoyasu had only committed a petty crime and placed him in the custody of Kiyomasa KATO.
But he determined that Satoyasu had committed merely a petty crime and placed him in the custody of Kiyomasa KATO.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 逆に、蒲生秀行に対しては「御家の統率がよろしくない」として、会津若松92万石から下野国宇都宮12万石に大減封されてしまったのである。
sen.e: On the other hand, the estate of Aizu Wakamatu of Hideyuki GAMO with the size of nine hundred twenty koku (around a hundred sixty million liters of rice crop yield) was greatly reduced to the Utsunomiya Domain, Shimotsuke Province with a hundred twenty thousand koku (approximately twenty one million and six hundred thousand liters of rice crop yield) by stating 'the leadership of lower-ranking vassal was not well.'

On the other hand, the Aizu Wakamatsu estate of Hideyuki GAMO, with a size of 920 koku (approximately 160,000,000 liters of rice-crop yield) was largely limited to the Utsunomiya domain, Shimotsuke Province, with 120,000 koku (approximately 21,600,000 liters of rice-crop yield) by stating that 'the leadership of the lower-ranking vassal was not well.'

In contrast, the Aizu Wakamatsu estate of Hideyuki GAMO, with a size of 920,000 koku (approximately 160,000,000 liters of rice-crop yield) was largely limited to the Utsunomiya domain, Shimotsuke Province, with W120,000 koku (approximately 21,600,000 liters of rice-crop yield) as 'incapable of ruling the lower-ranking vassals.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その後、会津には新たに越後国春日山から上杉景勝が120万石で入った。
sen.e: Kagekatsu UESUGI of Mount Kasuga, Echigo Province received the estate of Aizu and gained the estate of one thousand two hundred thousand koku (approximately two hundred sixteen million rice crop yield).
Kagekatsu UESUGI of Mount Kasuga, Echigo Province, received the estate of Aizu and thereby obtained 1,200,000 koku (a rice-crop yield of approximately 216,000,000 liters).
Kagekatsu UESUGI of the Kasugayama, Echigo Province, received the estate of Aizu and thereby obtained 1,200,000 koku (a rice-crop yield of approximately 216,000,000 liters).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 蒲生騒動における一連の騒動は、秀吉の意を受けた三成によって操られていた、もしくは三成本人が首謀者であったという説がある。
sen.e: There was a theory that the series of disturbances of Gamo-sodo was controlled by Mitsunari, who received the command of Hideyoshi or Mitsunari being the head conspirator.
There was a theory that the disturbances of Gamo-sodo were controlled by Mitsunari, who had received the command of Hideyoshi or Mitsunari, being the head conspirator.
There was a view that the disturbances of Gamo-sodo were manipulated by Mitsunari, who had received the command of Hideyoshi, or Mitsunari, as the head conspirator.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: まず、郷安についてであるが、御家騒動を成した張本人であるため処断されてもおかしくないものの、ほとんど罪に問われていないのは、三成が秀吉に弁護したためとされている。
sen.e: Since Satoyasu was the very person who triggered the family dispute, it was not unusual for him to receive a punishment but did not hardly received one perhaps because Mitsunari spoke for him to Hideyoshi.

Because Satoyasu was the very person who triggered the family dispute, it wouldn't have been unusual for him to receive a punishment; however, he was given barely any punishment because Mitsunari spoke to Hideyoshi on his behalf.

Because Satoyasu was the very person who triggered the family dispute, it was unusual for him to receive a punishment; however, he was given hardly any punishment because Mitsunari spoke to Hideyoshi on his behalf.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: さらにその後、郷安は早々と罪を許されて三成と懇意にあった小西行長の家臣となっている。
sen.e: Satoyasu was pardoned early and became the vassal of Yukinaga KONISHI, who had a close relation with Mitsunari.
Satoyasu was given an early pardon and became the vassal of Yukinaga KONISHI, who had a close relationship with Mitsunari.
Satoyasu was immediately given a pardon and became the vassal of Yukinaga KONISHI, who had a close relationship with Mitsunari.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: これは、三成の推挙があったためとされている。
sen.e: This was probably due to the recommendation from Mitsunari.
This was probably due to the recommendation from Mitsunari.
This was considered to have been due to a recommendation from Mitsunari.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 郷安は慶長5年（1600年）の関ヶ原の戦いで加藤清正軍との戦いに間に合わず、切腹して果てた。
sen.e: Satoyasu did not reach on time for the Battle of Sekigahara against the army of Kiyomasa KATO in 1600 that he committed seppuku (suicide by cutting one's stomach).
Satoyasu failed to arrive on time for the Battle of Sekigahara against the army of Kiyomasa KATO in 1600, so he committed seppuku (suicide by disembowelment).
Satoyasu was late for the Battle of Sekigahara against the army of Kiyomasa KATO in 1600, so he committed suicide by disembowelment.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、蒲生家に対する厳しい処分やその後における上杉景勝の入封に関しても疑問が残る。
sen.e: Furthermore, there were various uncertainties that remained concerning the severe punishment of Gamo family and Kagekatsu UESUGI moving into a new domain.
Furthermore, various uncertainties remained concerning the severe punishment of the Gamo family and Kagekatsu UESUGI's move to a new domain.
Besides, there are various doubts about the severe punishment of the Gamo family and Kagekatsu UESUGI's move to a new domain.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 秀行はまだ若年であるから、宿老らを統率できたとしても限度があるにもかかわらず「統率」を理由に減封している。
sen.e: Since Hideyuki was young, he would have faced limits even if he managed to unite chief vassals, but his estate was reduced due to his "leadership."
Given that Hideyuki was young, he would have faced limits even if he had managed to unite the chief vassals, but his estate was reduced due to his "leadership."
Given that Hideyuki was young, he would have had his limitation even if he had managed to unite the chief vassals, but his estate was reduced due to his 'poor leadership.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: さらに上杉景勝は家老の直江兼続を通じて石田三成と懇意にあった人物である。
sen.e: Kagekatsu UESUGI was a person who had a close relation with Mitsunari ISHIDA through his vassal, Kanetsugu NAOE.
Kagekatsu UESUGI had a close relationship with Mitsunari ISHIDA through his vassal, Kanetsugu NAOE.
Kagekatsu UESUGI had a close relationship with Mitsunari ISHIDA through his vassal, Kanetsugu NAOE.

sen.j: このため、関東における大大名・徳川家康を牽制するために重要な領土である会津に、秀吉や三成と懇意にあった上杉景勝を入封させるために計画した陰謀ではないかとされているのである。
sen.e: It must have been a conspiracy to assign Kagekasu UESUGI, who had a close friendship with Hideyoshi and Mitsunari, to Aizu, the estate that was crucial to suppress Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, who was the great daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in Kanto region.

It must have been a conspiracy to assign Kagekasu UESUGI, who had a close friendship with Hideyoshi and Mitsunari, to Aizu, the estate that was crucial for the suppression of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, the great daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the Kanto region.

It is considered to have been a conspiracy to assign Kagekatsu UESUGI, who had a close relationship with Hideyoshi and Mitsunari, to Aizu, the estate that was crucial for the suppression of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, the great feudal lord in the Kanto region.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この厳しすぎる処分は、関ヶ原の戦いで蒲生家を東軍に与させる遠因にもなっている。
sen.e: This severe punishment became the remote cause for the Gamo family to switch to the side of Eastern Army during the Battle of Sekigahara.
This severe punishment became an indirect cause in the Gamo family's switch to the side of the Eastern Army during the Battle of Sekigahara.
This severe punishment became an indirect reason for the Gamo family's switching to the side of the Eastern Army during the Battle of Sekigahara.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。
